layout_h.general1_Txt: The main application page for the Axis product can be altered to suit your own requirements, by customizing the features on the Live View page.
layout_h.general2_Txt: Select whether to Use Axis look for the whole product, or select Use Custom settings. For the latter, settings are made by clicking the Configure button. More on custom settings.
layout_h.default_view_Txt: To change the video source displayed as the default on the Live View page, select the individual source (or the quad stream) here.
layout_h.streamprofile_Txt: Stream profile - Select the stream profile from the drop-down list to use for the Live View page. Listed are the standard stream profiles as well as the ones created under Video
layout_h.videoformat_Txt: Select the video format to use for theLive View page.
layout_h.mJPEGTxt: Motion JPEG - Delivers a high quality video stream, from which individual images can be extracted and saved
layout_h.mPEG4: MPEG-4 - Video quality is comparable to Motion JPEG, but requires much less bandwidth
layout_h.h264Txt: H.264 - Better image quality with less bandwidth
layout_h.qualityTxt: Quality - Best image quality and full frame rate
layout_h.balancedTxt: Balanced - Medium image quality and frame rate
layout_h.bandTxt: Bandwidth - Low bandwidth with medium image quality
layout_h.showTxt: Check Show stream profile selection to place a stream profile drop-down list in Live View enabling the user to choose a profile for viewing.
layout_h.showPalTxt: Check Show palette selection to place a palette drop-down list in Live View enabling the user to choose a palette for viewing.
layout_h.iE_view_Txt: When using Microsoft Internet Explorer (IE) in Windows, select your preferred method of viewing moving images. The options are:
layout_h.view_IEhm_Txt: AMC (ActiveX) - This is the best choice for fast image updating in Internet Explorer for all stream profiles (MPEG-4, H.264 and Motion JPEG), but might not be possible on computers that have restrictions on the installation of additional software.
layout_h.view_IEh_Txt: AMC (ActiveX) - This is the best choice for fast image updating in Internet Explorer for all stream profiles (H.264 and Motion JPEG), but might not be possible on computers that have restrictions on the installation of additional software.
layout_h.view_IEm_Txt: AMC (ActiveX) - This is the best choice for fast image updating in Internet Explorer for all stream profiles (MPEG-4 and Motion JPEG), but might not be possible on computers that have restrictions on the installation of additional software.
layout_h.iE_AMC_check_Txt: When accessing the product with Internet Explorer for the first time, your computer is checked to see if AMC is already installed. If not found, or if the version found is older than the version supported in the product, you will be prompted to install the latest version.
layout_h.view_qtHM_Txt: QuickTime - For use with H.264 and MPEG-4 only.
layout_h.view_qt4_Txt: Note that in the settings for Video & Image > Advanced > MPEG-4, the Video object type must be set to Simple.
layout_h.view_javaAudio_Txta: Java applet - A slower imaging alternative to AMC for Motion JPEG, this alternative uses a Java applet to update the images in IE. AAC digital audio encoding cannot be used with Java applet. See Audio Settings.
layout_h.view_javaAudio_Txtb: Java applet - A slower imaging alternative to AMC for Motion JPEG, this alternative uses a Java applet to update the images in IE.
layout_h.java_note1_1Txt: Note that when this alternative is selected, external video sources will not be available on the Live View page
layout_h.java_note2_Txt: , and audio will be mono-directional only (to the client).
layout_h.view_still_Txt1: Still Image - Displays still images only (Motion JPEG). Hit the Refresh button in your browser to view a new image.
layout_h.others_view_Txt1: When using any other browser than Internet Explorer, select your preferred method of viewing images. The available options are:
layout_h.others_view_Txt2: Server Push - With this method, the product maintains and controls an open HTTP connection to the browser and sends data as and when required, for as long as required.
layout_h.others_view_Txt2-1: Server Push - With this method, the product maintains and controls an open HTTP connection to the browser and sends data as and when required, for as long as required. Note that it may not be possible to get audio when server push is used as a default viewer in Firefox browser.
layout_h.view_qtHM_Txt2: QuickTime - For use with H.264 and MPEG-4 only.
layout_h.view_qt4_Txt2: Note that in the settings for Video & Image > Advanced > MPEG-4, the Video object type must be set to Simple.
layout_h.view_other_java_Txta: Java applet - This alternative uses a Java applet to update the images in the browser. No download required. AAC digital audio encoding cannot be used with Java applet. See Audio Settings.
layout_h.java_audio_note1_Txt: Note that when this alternative is selected, external video sources will not be available on the Live View page
layout_h.java_audio_note1_add_audio_Txt: , and audio will be mono-directional only (to the client)
layout_h.java_note1_2Txt: Note that when this alternative is selected, external video sources will not be available on the Live View page.
layout_h.view_other_java_Txtb: Java applet - This alternative uses a Java applet to update the images in the browser. No download required.
layout_h.view_still_Txt2: Still Image - Displays still images only. Hit the Refresh button in your browser to view a new image.
layout_h.show_AAC_Txt: Enable AAC decoder installation - Check this box to enable the installation of the AAC decoder included with the AXIS Media Control. To prevent the installation of unlicensed copies uncheck this box.
layout_h.show_toolbar_Txt: Show viewer toolbar - Check this box to display the viewer toolbar under the image in your browser. The toolbar provides various controls for e.g. pausing the video stream, switching to full screen mode, etc.
layout_h.mPEG_install_Txt: Enable MPEG-4 decoder installation - By checking/unchecking this box, the administrator can enable or disable the installation of the MPEG-4 decoder included with AMC. This is used to prevent the installation of unlicensed copies. Further decoder licenses can be purchased from your Axis dealer.
layout_h.h264_install_Txt: Enable H.264 decoder installation - By checking/unchecking this box, the administrator can enable or disable the installation of the H.264 decoder included with AMC. This is used to prevent the installation of unlicensed copies. Further decoder licenses can be purchased from your Axis dealer.
layout_h.relCross_Txt: Show crosshair in PTZ joystick mode - This cross indicates the center of the image when viewing the video stream in PTZ joystick mode.
layout_h.defaultjoystick_Txt: Use PTZ joystick mode as default - Enabling this sets the PTZ mode to joystick. The mode can be changed temporarily on the PTZ Control Panel, but will default to joystick if this is selected.
layout_h.mPEG_rec_Txt: Enable recording button - Enabling this button allows the user to start a recording directly from the Live View page. The recording is saved in the folder specified in the Recording tab in the AMC Control Applet. Note that this button is only available when viewing with AMC.
layout_h.sVG_Txt: Show IV SVG data in image stream - The currently running IV module can display data directly in the video image. Check this box to enable.
layout_h.trigger_buttons_Txt: Show manual trigger button - When displayed on the Live View page, clicking these buttons (On and Off) manually starts and stops all events that are configured to trigger in this way.
layout_h.snapshot_button_Txt: Show snapshot button - Enabling the display of the Snapshot button allows users to save a Motion JPEG snapshot from the video stream by clicking the button. This button is mainly intended for use with browsers other than Internet Explorer (IE), or when otherwise not using AXIS Media Control (AMC) to view the video stream. AMC provides its own snapshot button.
layout_h.audio_clip_button_Txta: Show audio clip section - Enabling the display of the Audio clip drop-down box and play button allows users to play a pre-recorded audio clip from the camera. Go to Video & Audio > Audio Clips to work with the audio clips.
layout_h.audio_clip_button_Txtb: Play audio clip section - Enabling the display of the Audio clip drop-down box and play button allows users to play a pre-recorded audio clip from the product. Go to Audio > Audio Clips to work with the audio clips.
layout_h.autoTrack_buttons_Txt: Show autotracking button - When displayed on the Live View page, this button (Stop/Start Autotrack) manually stops and starts the autotracking feature. Autotracking detects movement in the camera's field of view and will follow the motion, e.g. a person or vehicle, until it disappears from the monitored area.
layout_h.irillumination_buttons_Txt: Show IR illumination - Check this box to make IR Illumination buttons (Activate IR illumination and Deactivate IR illumination) appear on the Live View page. The buttons can be used to manually turn on/off the light, use the slider bar to adjust the intensity of the IR LEDs. Note that the slider bar may not be active, depending on settings in the Camera Settings page.
layout_h.heater_fan_buttons_Txta: Show fan button - When displayed on the Live View page, this button manually starts the fan. Set the number of minutes the fan should run when the button is clicked.
layout_h.heater_fan_buttons_Txtb: Show heater button - When displayed on the Live View page, this button manually starts the heater. Set the number of minutes the heater should run when the button is clicked.
layout_h.links_Txt1: To display user-defined links on the Live View page, check the box for Show custom link, give the link a name and then enter the URL to link to. When defining a web link do not remove the 'http://' from the URL address.
layout_h.links_Txt2: Custom links can be used to e.g. run scripts or activate external devices connected to the server, or they can link to a standard web URL, i.e. to a web page.
layout_h.links_Txt3: Custom links defined as cgi links will run e.g. the script in the background, in a hidden frame. Defining the link as a web link will open the link in a new window.
layout_h.light_buttons_Txt1: The light source can be controlled directly from the Live View page, by enabling the display of light buttons.
layout_h.light_buttons_Txt2: To enable, select the type of control to use for the light. This can be set as Pulse, where clicking the single button activates the light with the defined Activate and Inactivate actions for the defined period.The pulse time can be set as short as 1/100 second, and as long as 60 seconds.
layout_h.light_buttons_Txt3: Active/Inactive displays 2 buttons, one for each action.
layout_h.light_buttons_Txt4: Slider provides a bar where sliding it to the left makes the light dimmer and sliding the bar to the right makes the light brighter.
layout_h.light_buttons_Txt5: For advanced users it is also possible to specify a custom Activate and Inactivate command sequence, using Plain config.
layout_h.input_ports_Txt: Check the boxes to show the status of the Input ports on the product Live View page. Go to Ports & Devices > I/O Ports to configure input ports.
layout_h.output_buttons_Txt1: An output on the product can be controlled directly from the Live View page, by enabling the display of output buttons.
layout_h.output_buttons_Txt2: To enable, select the type of control to use for the port. This can be set as Pulse, where clicking the single button activates the port for the defined period, or as Active/Inactive, which displays 2 buttons, one for each action. The selected type automatically displays the correct button(s) on the Live View page.
layout_h.output_buttons_Txt3: The pulse time can be set as short as 1/100 second, and as long as 60 seconds.
layout_h.ext_video_Txt1: Audio from product can be combined with live video from Axis network cameras and video encoders. When enabled, live video is displayed on the Live View page, for full functionality use Internet Explorer.
layout_h.ext_video_Txt2: External Video enabled - Check this box to enable external video on the live view page.
layout_h.ext_video_Txt3: IP address - Enter the IP address of the video source.
layout_h.ext_video_Txt4: Video format - Select a video format H.264 or MPEG-4. If the camera has both types of video streams choose H.264.
layout_h.ext_video_Txt5: User name and Password - Optionally, enter the video source's user name and password. If no credentials are entered, a login window will appear when accessing the Live View page. Note that the user name and password are saved on product and are sent unencrypted.
layout_h.ext_video_Txt6: To receive synchronized video and audio, it is recommended that the time settings in the product, the video source and the client computer are synchronized with an NTP Server. Go to System Options > Date & Time.

fileUpload_h.help1Txt1: To use your own files (e.g. web pages and images) as custom settings, they must first be uploaded to the Axis product.
fileUpload_h.help1Txt2: To do this, enter the name and path to the file to upload in the field provided. The file might be on e.g. your workstation. As an alternative to entering the path directly, click the Browse button and then select the correct file.
fileUpload_h.notSupCharTxt: Note: Only a-z, A-Z, 0-9, . and _ characters can be used in the uploaded file's name.
fileUpload_h.help3Txt1: Now select the user level for the uploaded file. Setting the user access level means that you have complete control over which files can be viewed by which users.
fileUpload_h.help3Txt2: When the file is shown correctly in the text field, click the Upload button.
fileUpload_h.help4Txt: All uploaded files are shown in the list in the lower section of the page. To remove a file, check the box provided next to it and then click the Remove button.

personalSettings_setup_h.help1Txt: The main application page for the Axis product can be adapted to suit requirements, by customizing the features on the Live View page or by uploading and using your own custom web page.
personalSettings_setup_h.help2Txt: To upload your own files (web pages or images), click the Upload/Remove button. Once this has been done, the files will be available in the drop-down list on this page. Help on uploading files.
personalSettings_setup_h.help3Txt1: Most of the items that can be configured will also require you to specify the location for the resource, e.g. the location of the background picture you wish to use.
personalSettings_setup_h.help3Txt2: This location may be one of your Own uploaded files, in which case it can be selected from the drop-down list associated with the item, but it may also be an External file located somewhere other than in the product. To use an external file, enter the URL in the field provided.
personalSettings_setup_h.help4Txt1: The following settings can be customized:
personalSettings_setup_h.help4Txt2: Background color - This is the color behind all of the text and images on the page.
personalSettings_setup_h.help4Txt3: Text color - Applies to all text on the page.
personalSettings_setup_h.help4Txt4: Background picture - Enter the URL to the picture.
personalSettings_setup_h.help4Txt5: Banner - The banner shown at the top of the window.
personalSettings_setup_h.help4Txt6: Banner link - To link the banner to a web address, enter the link here.
personalSettings_setup_h.help4Txt8: Logo link - Enter the link URL here.
personalSettings_setup_h.help4Txt9: Title - This is the title shown above the video stream.
personalSettings_setup_h.help4Txt10: Description - This text will be used as a description below the video stream.
personalSettings_setup_h.help4Txt11: Show setup link - Unchecking this link will mean that the setup tools for the product will then only be accessible by entering the full path to the tools in your browser. Please make a note of this address for future use.
personalSettings_setup_h.help6Txt: Use own home page - This should be checked to use a previously uploaded web page as the default page. Select the page from the drop-down list and click OK.
